rules.title: Table Football Rules
rules.basic.2: The first player or team to score 10 goals wins the set.
rules.basic.3: A match consists of several sets, number of sets is determined by players before starting the match.
rules.basic.4: For example, if players played 5 sets, in which one player won 3 sets and the other 2, the final score would be 3-2.
rules.basic.5: If time for a set is limited, the player or team with the most goals wins that set.
rules.basic.6: After a goal, the team who was scored against gets the right to serve the ball.
rules.basic.7: If the ball goes out of play, the team who last touched it loses possession.
rules.fouls.spinning: Spinning: Rotating any rod more than 360° before or after striking the ball is prohibited.
rules.fouls.deadball: Dead ball: If the ball stops in an unreachable area, it is put back in play from the nearest serving position.
rules.fouls.jarring: Jarring/tilting: Lifting or moving the table to affect ball movement is not allowed.
rules.fouls.reaching: Reaching into play area: Players may not reach into the play area while the ball is in play.
rules.serving.1: Before serving, ask if your opponent is ready.
rules.serving.2: The ball must touch two player figures before being shot toward the goal.
rules.serving.3: When serving, the ball cannot directly from the 5-rod score a goal.
rules.scoring.rankings: Rankings are determined by total points, with ties decided by:
rules.match.desc: A match consists of a series of sets. The number of sets is determined by players before starting the game.
rules.match.1: Each set is played until 10 goals are scored by one player/team
rules.match.2: The winner of the match is the player/team who won the majority of sets
rules.match.3: For example, in a 5-set match, if one player won 3 sets and the other 2, the final score is recorded as 3-2
rules.etiquette.1: Shake hands before and after each match.
rules.etiquette.2: Don't distract your opponent during play.
rules.etiquette.3: Wait for permission before retrieving the ball from the goal after a score.
rules.etiquette.4: After the match, leave the table in good condition for the next players.
